entry.title: Acrylic Reader is Here
entry.content:
Acrylic Reader project is launched.

After my 2 recent pull requests to Fluent Reader, I gave up to merge new features to Fluent Reader because yang991178 closed both my 2 pull requests. To know more about this, read my recent post.

Launched

Acrylic Reader is fully based on Fluent Reader and will keep up to date with it. Also I will add and improve some features of it.

Go to Acrylic Readerâ€™s GitHub home page to know more about this project.

Till now, Acrylic Reader has 2 more features than Fluent Reader and 1 feature merged into Fluent Reader. But why didnâ€™t I merge them into Fluent Reader?

Why didnâ€™t I merge them into Fluent Reader

I have tried twice to merge my new features to Fluent Reader, but failed twice. yang991178 didnâ€™t review my pull requests and closed them. To know what pull requests they are, go to yang991178/fluent-reader #86 and #88.

Closed

yang991178 said that he thought my pull requestsâ€™s animation update is not necessary. But his animation is really rigid that cuts the shadow when playing. And said that my animation will squeeze the contents. But my animation doesnâ€™t.

I am really disappointed, but I want to keep my new features. So Acrylic Reader launched.

Acrylic Reader will give you a better experience and more useful features.

Iâ€™m glad to merge all of my new features to Fluent Reader if yang991178 want to in the future.

To know what new features in Acrylic Reader are, visit the home page of Acrylic Reader.

entry.title: Closed. Closed Again.
entry.content:
yang991178/fluent-reader #86 and yang991178/fluent-reader #88 are closed by yang991178.

Before reading the following, you need to know what is Fluent Reader. To know it, read my recent post.

Closed

Iâ€™ve submitted a pull request to update acrylic effect for Fluent Reader which is designed to give users better experience, it is merged at last. That is my first time to contribute to this repository.

Also, that is my first time to use Fluent Reader. It is the best RSS reader Iâ€™ve never seen before. But itâ€™s not perfect with many small problems.

After this, I forked Fluent Reader and started to improve it then I submitted my first pull request to Fluent Reader.

Before merging this pull request yang991178 added a new animation for the menu and merged. This animation is based on clip-path and is not smooth which will cut the shadow when playing, this is a slow motion record of this animation.

So I edited it and created a new pull request #86:

Before (By yang991178)

After (By Me)

The animation by yang991178 is based on CSS clip-path which will "clip" the shadow and will affect the animation speed curve.

The animation by me based on CSS width will not.

But yang991178 closed my pull request just on the day I opened it without reviewing it just because he has tried to realize it with CSS width, but he found this animation will â€œsqueezeâ€ the contents.

I got that, too. But I fixed it with CSS overflow then the animation is almost perfect now as the video.

I still commented in that pull request, but 3 days later, yang991178 still didnâ€™t respond.

I created a new pull request then, but he closed it again in ONE day without reviewing.

Iâ€™ve gave it up now, but I have a new plan now.

New Plan

Iâ€™m going to clone Fluent Readerâ€™s source code and create a new repository contains it, I will keep this copy up to date and will improve it, but wonâ€™t create any pull request to merge to his source repository again. But if yang991178 request me to merge to his source repository, Iâ€™ll still be glad to merge.

entry.title: Do you use RSS?
entry.content:
I read things by RSS.

What Is RSS? & How to Use it?

Really Simple Syndication (RSS) is an XML-based document format for the syndication of web content so that it can be republished on other sites or downloaded periodically and presented to users.

Yes, Really Simple. You can just add the RSS feed URL to your RSS client. After that, your client will fetch new articles from the RSS feed URLs.

Actually, RSS is just a file on the Internet. It looks like this:

To see the source, go to the RSS feed of my blog.

And all you need to do is to know its link and add it to your RSS feeds list.

How do I Use RSS?

I use Fluent Reader.

Fluent Reader is an RSS reader based on Electron for desktop. Itâ€™s frontend is based on Fluent UI which is an UI framework by Microsoft based on React.

Fluent Readerâ€™s UI design is just wonferful, just like Windows UWP apps.

If you want to add an RSS feed, go to settings and enter your RSS feed URL in â€œAdd Sourceâ€ text field.

Then click â€œAddâ€ button. You will get your articles then:
